nodes.bodyText: It's odd that this constructor throws a more general exception, I would think it would have been the other way around.
This constructor is newer, so they probably made it less specific because they declared their exceptions too narrowly when they wrote the original method.
Looks like this changed got dinged by Sec bugs.  Should triage this before committing.
Here is the reference, I don't think it applies: https://find-sec-bugs.github.io/bugs.htm#URLCONNECTION_SSRF_FD
Yeah, I'm fixing that now. Also, my test didn't pass, so I still need to figure out if this actually fixes the bug I was seeing in the tests.
